reviews.text: Reciprocity with my home club enabled me to stay at the Sloane Club. The Club is located a short walk from the Sloane Square Underground serviced by the Circle and District Lines. The club is nestled on a quiet residential street just south of Sloane Square. The rooms were clean and well appointed, the staff reserved yet helpful and continental breakfast was included.
reviews.title: Perfect location
Very "clubby" Sloane Club
reviews.text: The housekeeping staff was quite noisy and disruptive on Sunday Morning (about 10am) but a quick call to the front desk solved the issue.

The name fits with the type of hotel - very "club" style. Rooms are "quaint" (read small) but the quality and newness of bathrooms varies widely. I don't think really meant for the business traveler - really unpredictable internet connections and pray that it doesn't break down on a Friday since there is no concept of getting anything fixed over a weekend... hopeless.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in London. Home from home!

reviews.text: The bar/lounge area is very attractive - warm and inviting... however, the hotel needs to come into the 21st century - I was not permitted to bring my laptop into the bar/lounge area...it didn't matter that I wanted to read the newspaper online - simply "not permitted" to have a laptop there. C'mon, let's be green and try to save trees by not having to read only printed matter!
reviews.title: A wonderful find
Ideal
reviews.text: The Reception staff lovely but booking a room by phone not a pleasant experience.... not very friendly or helpful. I've always had a problem booking anything more than 2 nights without being told I'd have to move rooms. Not a welcome experience during any hotel stay but in particular during a business trip.

We stayed here over the Olympics, and were pleased with their room rates and reasonable cancellation policy when the rest of London was requiring full pre-payment of truly outrageous hotel rates. I had reciprocity here from a local club, and while I have other hotels in London that I might enjoy more, the price here is a great value. We will consider returning.
reviews.title: Hits and misses

reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small, but they are very well kept, and the beds and nice sheets make for a comfortable sleep. Our bathroom was tiny, and the vinyl floor was well worn, but it did appear to be immaculately clean. They provide l'Occitane toiletries, which were appreciated. Internet was not the easiest to use, but eventually did work for us after a call to the front desk. The clientele here looked very nice, and there are large numbers of Americans visiting as reciprocal guests of various upscale clubs. Along with the regular membership, this makes for a very nice environment.
reviews.title: Fantastic accommodation in a great location

reviews.text: I will agree with whoever said that calling for a reservation was not the pleasantest experience. I had to ask for a confirmation number, and I never did get a written confirmation, which made me uneasy. I also didn't think the person I spoke with was very friendly. The front desk was quite helpful though, and arranged a car service for me with ease. This is actually a much larger hotel than I was expecting (138 rooms), and they seem to take up a good part of the real estate on Lower Sloane Street, which is a fantastic address, and very convenient to the Sloane Square tube. We enjoyed the Italian deli across the street for a nice cappuccino. So, I would recommend this hotel for a nice and relatively reasonably priced stay in London.
reviews.title: First class accommodations

reviews.text: Stayed here a couple of times and plan to go back regularly, the rooms are lovely, if sometimes small, bathrooms great, breakfast delicious (although the no business meetings rule should be more strongly enforced), drinks in the bar excellent and overall ambiance thoroughly lovely. Big fan.
reviews.title: Live like a Londoner

reviews.text: The SLOANE Club is a first class operation well run by Tony Murket and his excellent staff,the food is great quality and Andrew who over sees the food and beviridge goes out of his way to see that the guests are taken care of,I highly recommend this first class establishment
reviews.title: I consider it my second home
A hidden treasure in Central London
reviews.text: A private London club associated with many world-wide. Recently totally re-furbished, it offers two large designer-dream lounges that are ideal to entertain or have tea, The dining room offers great food by award-winning chefs at most reasonable prices. Special rooms are available for receptions. All rooms are air conditioned.
